title: Introduction of PugJs
content:
PugJs is a JavaScript template engine that creates frontends that you can manage. In other words, it provides client-side rendering. Using server-side such as React or any other JavaScript library makes the task easier. And also provides many powerful features Such as looping, conditional rendering, filters, and more, through which you can do a lot of work from the server-side. It also provides HTML to the client site. It is similar to HTML so it can be learned very easily. And the frontend is very easy to create because it provides extended methods.

Pre Requirements

  • Basic knowledge of NodeJs and ExpressJs
  • Intermediate Knowledge of HTML or CSS

Why you should choose PugJs.

1 - Dynamically render content

2 - You can provide the concept of decision making directly on the client-side.

3 - You can extend or inherit the PagJs code.

4 - Easy to learn.

5 - Same as HTML.

Features of PugJs.

1 - You can make variables, loops, conditions, and other logical operations.

2 - Inheritance or extend concepts.

3 - Codebase is similar to HTML.

4 - Dynamic Rendering in use of server-side directly.

How To Learn PugJs

PugJs are very easy to learn. Through their website. Website

Installation

Install PugJs using npm

 npm install pug or yarn add pug

Directory Structure

Directory Structure

Codes

//app.js

Javascript

 //Express For Routing const express = require('express'); const app = express(); //PugJs Template Engine for render HTML const pug = require('pug'); //Port for run web application const port = 3000; //path module for accessing static or views files. const path = require('path'); //set pugjs template app.set('view engine','pug'); //set path of views folder to access pugjs file and render it. app.set('views',path.join(__dirname,'views')); //make get endpoint. app.get("/",(req,res)=>{ res.render("index"); }) //server listen app.listen(port, ()=>{ console.log(`Server is running : http://www.localhost:${port}/`); })
